proof: Proof. Since $C(u) = C(v)$, we can relate the cost to the symmetric difference of the neighborhoods. As the cardinality of the symmetric difference, $|N(u)\Delta N(v)|$, is a metric, any node $w \in N(u)\Delta N(v)$ must have $C(w) \neq C(u)$. Thus, there are at least $|N(u)\Delta N(v)|$ disagreements incident to $u$ and $v$. For every $uv \in \varphi_2^+$, we have $\text{cost}_C(u) + \text{cost}_C(v) \ge |N(u)\Delta N(v)| \ge \beta \cdot M_{uv}$.
